column144:
A. Owner-occupied housing for which the total annual cost of ownership, including principal interest, taxes, insurance, and condominium fees, does not exceed 30 percent of the gross annual income of a household at 120% of the county median income as defined by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.
B. Rental housing for which the total annual cost of renting, including rent, utilities, and condominium association fees, does not exceed 30 percent of the gross annual income of a household at 80% of the county median income as defined by the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development.
column170: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit

column22: Buildings in this district must maintain their historical integrity, and any construction must match the architectural features, materials, and character of other buildings in the district. Buildings cannot be demolished unless they are significantly damaged (>70% of assessed value) and anything that can be repaired as opposed to replaced should be.

column22: Maximum lot coverage (buildings) must be compatible w/existing structures. Buildings over 35' are conditional and must be set back equal to height. Maximum density is 1 principal structure/20000 sq ft for all residential treatments.
